issue.title: [CF 976] [Beta] Skin Conflicts w/ElvUI
issue.body:
http://puu.sh/aoRkj/04092010db.jpg

Turning off Ace3 skinning in ElvUI fixes this by not skinning TMW, but I figure I might as well report the conflict. Not entirely sure if I should be reporting this to you or to Elv, so feel free to tell me "It's his problem not mine" and close the ticket. If you need a version of the Elv beta to troubleshoot, lemme know and I can upload you the lastest build and send it to you.

E: On the Elv beta git, there have been some newer builds which note that they fix some issues w/Ace3 skinning. Might have fixed itself but I won't know until servers come back up.


> Posted by CurseForge user Jalopyy | Imported from CurseForge issue #976 | Raw

comments.body:
http://puu.sh/aoSgV/a662dbb315.jpg

Also, probably add Gladiator Stance to this condition list.


> Posted by CurseForge user Jalopyy

'Item is Equipped' conditions also seem to be broken.


> Posted by CurseForge user Jalopyy

Definitely ElvUI's problem. TMW doesn't mess with the internals of any of the Ace3-GUI stuff.

Something to add to this list of things that aren't working - Spell Has No Mana conditions dont work with spell names. any any icons that check this also don't work if they check by spellID. I can only hope that this build fixes GetSpellInfo(), but its doubtful.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

http://puu.sh/arnVK/0203de1e12.jpg

Hidden icons seem to still have a cooldown sweep of some sort. To note, the group's opacity is set as 0.


> Posted by CurseForge user Jalopyy

Yarp. Its because right now, cooldown sweeps are ignoring their parents opacity. I put in a workaround, but forgot to account for groups also being able to have an opacity of 0.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Also, I accidentally ignored this one from your last ticket:

Quote:

4) Not so much a bug, but it may be. Trying to make a working spell cooldown aura for Gladiator Stance's "Shield Charge" ability. For some reason the aura won't show up as it should. When I try to track a similar ability (charge with the Double Time talent), it tracks perfectly fine, so it has to be something with this ability specifically (and as such might be on Blizzard's end). I've tried tracking by naming it Shield Charge, Shield Block (the ability shield charge replaces by spec'ing into glad stance), and by setting the exact spell ID. http://pastebin.com/bQYhynRS


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Like I said, it works now that I put the exact spellID of the spell that gets replaced by Shield Charge (2565), but won't work if you simply input the name of Shield Block/Shield Charge, or specifically list Shield Charge by ID. Unsure if TMW error of Blizz error.

E: For the time being, should I check all of those icons as 'Always Hide', then?

Edited Jul 25, 2014

> Posted by CurseForge user Jalopyy

No. Fixed in gf2a4cb9, packaging now.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Regarding Shield Charge:

I would say its a blizzard bug. GetSpellInfo("Shield Charge") isn't returning anything. Normally, these sort of things (spells that replace other spells) return things just fine.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
